title: Drawing, "Design for a Confident", ca. 1780
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, above: Élevation d'un Confident Sculpetué et garnie / avecque Son Caute Lateral tous pret à Meublie,; lower right space: Le Confident est un / meuble de parate; right: 42 pouce de hauteur
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A sofa divided into three sections, shown frontally at left, and in left profile and right; upholstered arms surmounted by urns with flowers; in the center, above, a trophy consisting of a helmet, quiver of arrows and laurel leaves.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Confident", ca. 1780.
ca. 1780. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-176.
